creator: max@cert.cx
text:
comparing do_rewritelog() in line 2.2 and 2.4 I've found missing inheritance for CVE-2013-1862 what may provide to writes data to a log file without sanitizing

2.2
   logline = apr_psprintf(r->pool, "%s %s %s %s [%s/sid#%pp][rid#%pp/%s%s%s] "
                                    "(%d) %s%s%s%s" APR_EOL_STR,
                           rhost ? ap_escape_logitem(r->pool, rhost) : "UNKNOWN-HOST",
                           rname ? ap_escape_logitem(r->pool, rname) : "-",


and 

2.4
    logline = apr_psprintf(r->pool, "%s %s %s [%s/sid#%pp][rid#%pp/%s%s%s] "
                                    "%s%s%s%s",
                           rhost ? rhost : "UNKNOWN-HOST",
                           rname ? rname : "-",


Why this is not patched since 2013 in 2.4? What is the reason for such a difference?
This patch is not needed for 2.4.x as the rewrite loging in in 2.4.x uses the standard httpd logging API which does the escaping later on before printing it to the file.
creator: rpluem@apache.org
